reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 12 -15 Aug, during the festival. It is easily reached from Waverley Station( the little alley way opposite leads directly down to the station entrance).
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly placed within easy walking distance to virtually all of the main Edinburgh attractions. The hotel itself is modern, clean etc just what you would expect from a city centre hotel. It is not cheap at £220 per night excluding breakfast, but this being my first time in Edinburgh it was great to be 'in the thick of it'.
reviews.title: Terrific Hotel

likes.liked: — Luxurious fluffy towels in the bathroom

reviews.title: Good location, room for improvement
reviews.text: We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as it seemed pricey (unless you're someone who has absolutely everything on offer!!) but we went to 'Always Sunday' a little cafe just 5 minutes up the road next to the fringe shop, very nice tea & coffee, juice/museli/fruit/smoked salmon & scrambled eggs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also there is a nice pub 'The Advocate' (round the corner in the square) for lunch, we only found this on our last day!!
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

likes.liked: — The location,the rooms and the staff

reviews.title: Superb location - High standard hotel
reviews.text: Maybe rates are more favourable at other times of year, but if you want to be central then you can't go wrong.

Lovely weekend, facilities and parking ideal. The food and service thrughout the stay was good but not too happy about being overcharged for mini bar drinks, a bill was sent to home despite paying on departure!! Error by reception.
reviews.title: Great base for a city break in the heart of the historical part of city

reviews.text: I have been staying at the Radisson for a number of years and always enjoy my stay. It's a reliable hotel with great customer service, a good bar and is in a perfect location.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location. Lovely (but expensive) breakfast

reviews.text: Make sure you take a walk to Grassmarket. It's only 5 minutes away and there are some great bars and restaurants in what i think is a very under explored area of Edinburgh. In particular eat at Petit Paris... absolutely fantastic little place!
reviews.title: Bedroom was tired

reviews.text: Public areas in this hotel and breakfast choice and quality was good. Staff at check-in and checkout were also very good. Location is very central.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a perfect location

reviews.text: My low rating reflects my disappointment with my room (135 from memory) which, whilst it had a great big comfy bed, just felt a bit tired, whether seen in the condition of the carpet or the chips and stains on furnishings. The room also had no view and did suffer from a bit of noise from the street outside when last orders had been called.
reviews.title: Great hotel well situated

reviews.text: We stayed in October 2013 for a weekend break in Edinburgh. The hotel was a very good standard of cleanliness, upkeep and service. The pool and spa are good quality with very good service. Rooms are well equiped and have very comfy beds! The hotel is located on the royal mile and is in a great location for siteseeing,bars/restaurants and shops. The only down side I could see was that the breakfast was very expensive, we used local restaurant for breakfast (Garfunkels was good value) and the bar was very pricey at £5 for a bottle of Stella Cidre. Overall would definately recomend.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a weekend break
Nice hotel, shame about the noise!
reviews.text: A nice hotel, in a great location. Staff were pleasant. I ordered room service one evening and the food was lovely. The location of this hotel is fantastic. A short walk to many main attractions, i.e. Castle, Holyrood Palace, Princess Street. Breakfast was very good. Variety and fully replenished until finishing time. Staff politely reminded when the buffet would close, for any last minute selection. The room was comfortable. The only downside being that our room overlooked a street of pubs and karaoke clubs. It was noisy well into the early hours, with clubbers lingering on (4am), although the extra glazing went some way to keeping the noise out. Unfortunately, I like sleeping with the window open. If you like a sound night's sleep, I suggest you request a room away from the side street.

I stayed in the Radisson in Edinburgh for a long weekend with a friend a few a months ago. The hotel itself is nice and it has a fantastic location. The breakfast is delicious and there is fantastic choice. However, I found the dinner menu in the restaurant quite limited. The TV in our room didn't work and we mentioned it to the reception staff assuming it would be fixed. When we returned late that night, tired after a long day sightseeing it was not fixed and all we wanted to do was watch a movie. We rang reception asking if someone could fix it. However, they told us the repairman was finished for the day and that we should have asked earlier!
reviews.title: Holiday Ruined By Spa Experience

reviews.text: Based on just the above information I would rate the hotel four out of five, however, after my experience in their Spa I have reduced the rating. My friend and I decided to get massages on the second day of our four day trip and from there my holiday was ruined. The masseuse told me that I had a particular condition in my back during the massage. I had never had back problems before and was alarmed at the blasé manner in which she told me that I had quite a serious condition. After the massage (which was meant to be gentle, aromatherapy type of massage) I was in agony for a number of days. I could not stop worrying during the rest of the stay. After returning home and visiting a chiropractor, physiotherapist and my GP and also taking my first ever sick day due to the stress and physical pain I was in, I do not have this condition.
reviews.title: BUSINESS TRIP ONLY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I tried to get info from the masseuse at the stay and I now feel that I should have brought this to the attention of a manager but I was in shock and laughed it off with my friend as I didn't want to ruin her holiday by making a fuss but it did ruin my trip which I had much planned and saved for.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: I recently spent a week in Edinburgh and stayed at the Radisson and thought it was a great hotel. The best thing about the hotel is the location. It is situated about half way on the Royal Mile with Edinburgh Castle on one end, Holyrood Palace on the other and about a 5-10 minuted walk to Waverly Station and Princes Street Gardens.
reviews.title: Very Nice Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: The hotel itself is modern with fairly decent sized rooms (for European standards). The rooms were very clean and very quite even though there were two bars below our windows that didn't close till 3am (we never heard them and that was nice). The only thing to get used to is the fact that the beds have duvet covers instead of sheets and blankets that American's are used to, but if you don't like them you can call down to the front desk and request a sheet and blanket.
reviews.title: Unbeatable Royal Mile location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff was very nice (housekeeping always said good morning to us in the halls). Breakfast is included with the price of some rooms so find out if you room includes it or not before going down in the moring otherwise you have to pay for it. The resturant located next to the lobby (Itchycoo) is wonderful. They have excellent drinks as well as desserts (my recomendation is the Pick Three where you get small samples of three different items).
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

likes.disliked: — Missed some areas of cleaning in bathroom (hey, mistakes happen!)

reviews.text: All in all this was a great hotel to stay at while in Edinburgh. I would definitely stay here again as wells as recomend it to anyone. If it is booked when you are in Edinburgh, try the Bank Hotel next door and The Carlton down the street for the same great location as the Radisson. Enjoy :)
reviews.title: Excellent for a weekend break

reviews.text: As so many other reviews note, the location of this proprety is simply unbeatable for tourists. There simply isn't a better place to be in Edinburgh. The hotel is a clean, very modern, business hotel with all that one would expect of such a facility.
reviews.title: Great location, very comfortable room

reviews.text: A 2 night stay in a Business room at £175 per night. The hotel is clean, well-presented and superbly located. It is contemporary and 'feel-good'.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is on the Royal Mile and therefore brilliantly located for all that Edinburgh has to offer. The room we had was upgraded to Business Class although we were struggling to see what we got that was extra but it was comfortable with good views out to Arthur's Seat and beyond. Over our 3 night stay we ate out each evening and only had one breakfast in the hotel which whilst okay was probably not worth the money when you can get perfectly good breakfasts nearby for less. Whilst the room was perfectly clean and presentable the corridors had definitely seen better days and were desperately in need of updating/refurbishment. Quite expensive for what it was but I guess you are paying for the location as much as anything.
reviews.title: Good location with parking

reviews.text: The location is great, the staff were friendly, the room was nice and spacious with a good bathroom - exactly what you would expect from a 4 star. Breakfast was £12, so I had high expectations. But god was it bad. Tasted like they had bought the cheapest croissants they could find, I took one bite and had to stop. I then went to get some cucumber but it looked - and tasted - like it had been sitting there overnight or even for the last week, it literally made me heave. If you stay here I would not recommend having breakfast, there are plenty of cafés nearby which I'm sure would have edible food and would be cheaper. The coffee was ok though.
reviews.title: Seriously let down by breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise this is a great hotel. Staff were very friendly. We had requested an early check in as we arrived in Edinburgh quiet early in the morning. This was not a problem. Even though the hotel was very busy they had our room key ready for us at reception when we arrived at about 10am. Nothing was a problem for the staff. The bar was a little bit pricey but we found that all in all Edinburgh itself was very pricey. A friend had travelled from London and found prices everywhere more expensive than there.
reviews.title: Great Stay in Edinburgh

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast in the hotel was fantastic with a large selection of delicious food.....
reviews.title: Seems Radisson is cutting back on amenities

reviews.text: Excellent location on the Royal Mile and not far from the train station. Tthe bed was good. The room failry large. Breakfast very expensive as in all the Radissons but we were a little suprised at how they seem to be cheapening out. There was only one small bar of soap that you had transfer between shower and sink, only one glass and no clock of any kind. Surprising.
reviews.title: Excellent location on the Royal Mile
Excellent accommodation
reviews.text: room. We booked late, and that's the only thing they had.
The room was great, very comfortable, stylish, modern and
reviews.title: Not for Children!!!!

reviews.text: clean. The hotel is Old Town, which is very picturesque,
reviews.title: Good business hotel to use, central, efficient and stylish.

reviews.text: and it blends in with all the stone buildings, though I believe
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for three nights over New Year, having last stayed while on a business trip about three years ago. On the plus side, the room was on the top floor so was quiet and we didn't hear too much noise from nearby bars and clubs. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly and bar service is quick. The location is absolutely spot on, right at the heart of the action in Edinburgh. The room was fine although on New Year's Day we didn't have our room serviced until teatime. On the minus side, the hotel is now in need of a refresh. The swimming pool area in particular is starting to look grotty and the pool temperature was too cold. A couple of tips: don't bother with breakfast - there are numerous cafes and bars nearby that are much cheaper. Also, crisps and nuts from the hotel bar are complementary so get yourself a bowl and take it back to your room rather than taking stuff from the room bar which will cost you money.
reviews.title: Starting to show its age

reviews.text: An old and historic exterior gave way to a modern and upscale interior.
reviews.title: Royal treatment on the Royal Mile

reviews.text: Very well situated in the heart of the Royal Mile and close to excellent pubs and shops. The staff were very courteous, the room was clean, spacious and modern and the Edinburgh marathon brought in an ecletic crowd.
reviews.title: Excellent stay in Edinburgh

reviews.text: From check in to check out the staff was excellent and very helpful
reviews.title: location location location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first night the movie service in the room wasn't working and they had someone up immediately. That was the only issue I had with the stay, other wise the room was very comfortable and large with a nice view to Salisbury Craigs and the morning breakfast room was very bright and airy with a great selection of food.
reviews.title: Needs some work!

reviews.text: I really liked the modern elegant design, the spacious rooms (with a comfortable bed) and the service (personnel always smilling and very kind)! Highlights: the breakfast buffet and the location!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, best location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It looks great from the outside. Located on the Royal Mile in an ideal spot. The Reception is welcoming and the staff friendly.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I read other reviews of this hotel and consider are my expectations too high? NO! This is a premium price hotel but it doesn't offer value for money. It takes more than a great location and smiley faces.
reviews.title: christmas at the radisson. like spending christmas with family

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kurt Ritter, President and CEO of Rezidor Hotel Group offers 100% satisfaction to his customers. "We guarantee you'll be satisfied. It's our promise to you that in every hotel, every day you can expect to be satisfied with Radisson Blu. If you aren't satisfied with something, please let one of our staff know during your stay & we'll make it right or you won't pay. IT'S GUARANTEED."
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.text: Sadly this hotel falls well short of that promise. Expectations were not met by even 50%. The bedroom carpet is threadbare. The rooms offer no luxury what-so-ever. The bed is OK but not overly comfortable. The bedding is standard hollowfill and too thin and too small for the bed. The pillow menu offers no better selection than already on the bed. There is no effort to make the room look anymore appealing than a Premier Inn room. The bedside light buzzes. The bathroom extractor sounds like distant welding and is completely ineffectual. The Shower water temperature fluctuates. The tiling is grubby. The corridor looks like a hostel, extremely dirty carpet, dirty walls and no effort to make it attractive.
reviews.title: Great location for centre of Edinburgh

reviews.text: I've lived here for 3 nights last year on July. The location was the main reason I decided to have a try. And it was great! The building of the hotel was very scottish and its just located on the royal mile , very easy to access and reach anywhere else in the city. The room was spacious and the ultility was great. The decoration in the guestroom was very modern but comfortable and I especially like the design of the window. The view from the window was great (since we were in Edinburgh). The staff were very friendly and quick response to our request of having room at higher floors.
reviews.title: Excellent experience will come back again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Compare to other Radisson hotels in the U.K. , this one would definatly be the best one to me.
reviews.title: A great home base while in Edinburgh

reviews.text: I was very satisfied with the Radisson SAS hotel. My husband and I stayed there while in Edinburgh at the end of August. This hotel's best asset is it's location! It is located on the Royal Mile in Edinburgh's Old Town. Located about half way between the castle and the palace at Holyroodhouse. The decor is very clean, attractive and modern. The bed was incredibly comfortable, probably the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept on. The room and bathroom were spacious and the staff were very friendly and helpful. There is also a great pub across the street called The Mitre, good hearty food and prices that can't be beat! I definately recommend this hotel and would stay there again.
reviews.title: unbeatable location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 13-16 August, during the Edinburgh Festival. The location was perfect, we were situated in the Royal Mile, within walking distance of the main festival venues and right next to the official box office.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is clean, modern, staff were helpful and friendly. Our room cost 215 pounds a night not including breakfast and as we were room only we found the 16 pounds for a full Scottish breakfast a bit pricey. The following two mornings we went to Garfunkels down the road where we paid a third of that.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with its own Fringe Shows!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here for 2 nights and it is in the perfect location and hotel!
reviews.title: weekend stay and cannot fault hotel!
Superb stay-recommended!
reviews.text: we took the bus from the airport and it stopped right outside the hotel! all the shops and restaurants our right outside therefore chose to eat breakfast elsewhere at a fraction of the cost.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: everything is in walking distant, princess street/bus stops/ castle/tours.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.text: we also had a massage and that was really good!
reviews.title: Great location, nice room
Excellent stay in the capital
reviews.text: there was only one thing i did not like about the hotel which is a minor detail and that was the pillow felt like it was a pillow or air as soon as you put your head in the middle the sides would inflate it was really uncomfortable!

The hotel is located right in the middle of world-famous Royal Mile, and is withing walking distance from nearly all must-see places in the city centre and from the train station. Good room, very clean, good breakfast, plenty of restaurants around. Very helpful staff at the reception. The city has got major power cut on the day we were checking out, which has affected the hotel and all the area around, but the hotel staff managed to sort through the whole mess quite quickly and efficiently. Definitely would stay again!
reviews.title: Unbeatable location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I put this hotel in the mid-range moving to more expensive cost of hotel, we got it at a discount for £99 breakfast not included. I think it is good for the money it is a nice hotel in a good location it has discounted parking also at £12.50 per night.
reviews.title: Good solid hotel

reviews.text: You get a comfortable room of the same standard of a premier inn type, so you know what you are getting, overall I would stay here again and I would recommend it as we had no reason to complain. It is 5-10min walk from Waverly train station so it is central.
reviews.title: Lovely!

reviews.text: There are plenty of bars and restaurants near by so you have no worries on that front
reviews.title: excellent hotel for a city break

reviews.text: Lovely hotel, perfect location! I stayed here by myself on a mid week break. The staff were very helpful.
reviews.title: Perfect position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Radisson for 2 nights in October. We had booked a standard room but on arrival were upgraded to a suite with separate living room and spacious bedroom, which was a lovely surprise. The room was very clean, the decor modern and the bed larger than king-size. We heard hardly any noise from outside, even though we were staying on a Friday and Saturday night. Our room was on the 5th floor and had some amazing views of Edinburgh, including Salisbury craggs. The hotel is located right in the centre of the oldest part of the city, within easy walking distance to many of the famous sights, including the castle and Holyrood park. We chose to eat breakfast in cafes on the Royal Mile since the hotel's breakfast was quite expensive; Always Sunday is a great place for breakfast and has an excellent vegetarian version of the full Scottish breakfast, complete with vegetarian haggis! In contrast to some of the reviews posted for this hotel, we found the staff to be friendly and helpful. If we return to Edinburgh we will definitely stay at the Radisson.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in the last week of the 2007 Festival and could not have asked for a better location. Positioned midway on the Royal Mile it was within easy walking distance of most activities.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: The room was clean, well maintained, modern and a good size by European standards. The staff were always pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel apart from Reception staff

reviews.text: The only possible down-side was the rate which was the highest we paid in 5 weeks of travelling but given the location and timing of our visit it was money well spent. I would certainly stay there again and recommend it to other visitors.
reviews.title: Great Rooms and Amazing Location

likes.disliked: — dependancy on using the credit card for payment

reviews.text: Fantastic hotel in the heart of Royal Mile. Staff were so helpful and friendly. Excellent spa facilities! Gorgeous breakfast (so much variety). I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a business suite which was an unexpected surprise!!Would love to goback!!
reviews.title: Amazing!!

reviews.text: Loved this place - centrally located, rooms are spacious, quiet and clean. Service was excellent and food nice. It's within walking distance to everything, and when you book in advance there are some great deals to be had.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel
Unexpected excellence
reviews.text: We stayed here on a Saturday night, easy parking under the hotel, easy walking distance to all local attractions. Situated on a very busy street (The Royal Mile!) the double glazing is excellent so it was very peaceful in the room. We had cocktails in the bar, which was very busy but the service was very good. Breakfast in our room was served promptly and hot. All staff were pleasant. Over all a very enjoyable stay. Will stay here again.

The men and women who work in this hotel from the front desk to food service are very friendly and helpful. They have endless patience with every question and have excellent suggestions for all topics. My room had a comfortable mattress, pillows, and duvet. My bathroom was spacious as well as my bedroom. My room faced Whiski (restaurant) and I had a good time watching the Edinburgh Festival's large amount of tourists walking up and down The Royal Mile all day and into the night. Even though my room faced The Royal Mile, I was not aware of any noise due to the large amount of people on the street. The breakfast buffet had a lot of hot and cold items to choose from and the coffee was good which wasn't always the case while I traveled throughout Scotland. This hotel is located a few blocks from Edinburgh Castle and in the middle of the many shops and side streets that are important for serious shoppers. It was also near a Co Op which was convenient for me since I enjoyed having snacks in my room while I was there. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Unbeatable Location For Downtown

reviews.text: This hotel is excellent for it's location - right on the royal mile in the middle of all the action. Unfortunately that's also it's downfall as it can be very noisy depending which way your room faces. There is a music bar to the left of the hotel which stays open quite late. I travel to Edinburgh on business, where the Radisson is my second choice, and have no complaints, very typical Radisson. Good rooms, comfortable bed, excellent breakfast buffet and free wifi.
reviews.title: Standard Radisson, but can be noisy
